Utils Module¶

Utility functions (e.g. Determining the remote system OS)

modules.utils.try_import(module_name)[source]¶

Import and return module_name.

>>> try_import("csv") 
<module 'csv' from '...'>

Unlike the standard try/except approach to optional imports, inspect the stack to avoid catching ImportErrors raised from within the module. Only return None if module_name itself cannot be imported.

>>> try_import("spam.spam.spam") is None
True
modules.utils.what_os()[source]¶

Returns a string indicating the Host OS. Currently Only supports ‘redhat’ and ‘ubuntu’
